fr.ensimag.deca.tree

Class AbstractExpr

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ensimag.deca.tree.Tree
      • fr.ensimag.deca.tree.AbstractInst
        • fr.ensimag.deca.tree.AbstractExpr
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBinaryExpr, AbstractLValue, AbstractReadExpr, AbstractStringLiteral, AbstractUnaryExpr, BooleanLiteral, FloatLiteral, IntLiteral, TestPlusWithoutMock.DummyIntExpression

    public abstract class AbstractExpr
extends AbstractInst
    Expression, i.e. anything that has a value.

    • Method Detail

      • isImplicit

        boolean isImplicit()
        Returns:
        true if the expression does not correspond to any concrete token in the source code (and should be decompiled to the empty string).

      • getType

        public Type getType()
        Get the type decoration associated to this expression (i.e. the type computed by contextual verification).

      • setType

        protected void setType(Type type)

      • checkDecoration

        protected void checkDecoration()
        Description copied from class: Tree
        Check that the current node has correctly been decorated, and throws an error if not. This is used only for defensive programming, each node type can add checks by overloading this method. Does nothing by default. The method is called automatically by Tree.checkAllDecorations().
        Overrides:
        checkDecoration in class Tree

      • verifyExpr

        public abstract Type verifyExpr(DecacCompiler compiler,
                                EnvironmentExp localEnv,
                                ClassDefinition currentClass)
                         throws ContextualError
        Verify the expression for contextual error. implements non-terminals "expr" and "lvalue" of [SyntaxeContextuelle] in pass 3
        Parameters:
        compiler - (contains the "env_types" attribute)
        localEnv - Environment in which the expression should be checked (corresponds to the "env_exp" attribute)
        currentClass - Definition of the class containing the expression (corresponds to the "class" attribute) is null in the main bloc.
        Returns:
        the Type of the expression (corresponds to the "type" attribute)
        Throws:
        ContextualError

      • verifyRValue

        public AbstractExpr verifyRValue(DecacCompiler compiler,
                                 EnvironmentExp localEnv,
                                 ClassDefinition currentClass,
                                 Type expectedType)
                          throws ContextualError
        Verify the expression in right hand-side of (implicit) assignments implements non-terminal "rvalue" of [SyntaxeContextuelle] in pass 3
        Parameters:
        compiler - contains the "env_types" attribute
        localEnv - corresponds to the "env_exp" attribute
        currentClass - corresponds to the "class" attribute
        expectedType - corresponds to the "type1" attribute
        Returns:
        this with an additional ConvFloat if needed...
        Throws:
        ContextualError

      • verifyCondition

        void verifyCondition(DecacCompiler compiler,
                     EnvironmentExp localEnv,
                     ClassDefinition currentClass)
              throws ContextualError
        Verify the expression as a condition, i.e. check that the type is boolean.
        Parameters:
        localEnv - Environment in which the condition should be checked.
        currentClass - Definition of the class containing the expression, or null in the main program.
        Throws:
        ContextualError

      • decompileInst

        protected void decompileInst(IndentPrintStream s)
        Description copied from class: AbstractInst
        Decompile the tree, considering it as an instruction. In most case, this simply calls decompile(), but it may add a semicolon if needed
